passages.text:
New York, 203X, July 4th evening

The road to the international airport named after John F. Kennedy was quite congested this evening. The dark silver Ford I was driving was making its way towards Terminal D.

I moved my gaze to Michael. He was sitting in the next seat and reading some documents on the tablet.

Michael... I wasn't sure if that was his real name. These Government guys adore shadow.

After a few seconds, he noticed my gaze and barely smiled:

- What? Don’t you think about how to get out of the car until it comes to land?

[[Fuck you, Michael. Your office owes me a couple of zeros in the contract..]]
[[Of course I don't mind, but I can't do it, right?]] 
[[Work’s work. Although I don't really like being kicked out of the conference. I really wanted to learn something new about this modern AI model.]]

links.link: Fuck you, Michael. Your office owes me a couple of zeros in the contract..

links.link: Work’s work. Although I don't really like being kicked out of the conference. I really wanted to learn something new about this modern AI model.

passages.name: Начало

passages.text:
Michael laughed.

- I like your spirit, I'll talk about it with my boss. Maybe if you complete this task, you can add three more.

He made a thoughtful face for a second, and then looked at me:

 Speaking of the task, have you already read the briefing?

[[In general terms.Is it something about CAR Corporation?]] 
[[No, I didn't have any time. So you have ten minutes before we get there.]]

links.name: In general terms.Is it something about CAR Corporation?
links.link: In general terms.Is it something about CAR Corporation?

links.name: No, I didn't have any time. So you have ten minutes before we get there.
links.link: No, I didn't have any time. So you have ten minutes before we get there.

passages.name: Fuck you, Michael. Your office owes me a couple of zeros in the contract..

passages.text:
Michael chuckled.

-Of course not. In addition, we have already bought a ticket to Athens.  It would be a shame if you suddenly don’t go and waste taxpayers' money. 

Speaking of Athens, have you already read the briefing?

[[In general terms.Is it something about CAR Corporation?]] 
[[No, I didn't have any time. So you have ten minutes before we get there.]]

links.name: In general terms.Is it something about CAR Corporation?
links.link: In general terms.Is it something about CAR Corporation?

links.name: No, I didn't have any time. So you have ten minutes before we get there.
links.link: No, I didn't have any time. So you have ten minutes before we get there.

passages.name: Of course I don't mind, but I can't do it, right?

passages.text:
- Totally hard at work, right? Don't worry, you're not being asked to do anything outside of your job, are you?

There was nothing to object. I worked on AI and neural interfaces. Our team of scientists was looking for a way to train a machine using the knowledge of a living brain. If it works, the process of creating and learning would be accelerated at times.

Michael interpreted my silence right and chuckled.

- Speaking of business, have you already read the briefing?

[[In general terms.Is it something about CAR Corporation?]] 
[[No, I didn't have any time. So you have ten minutes before we get there.]]

links.name: In general terms.Is it something about CAR Corporation?
links.link: In general terms.Is it something about CAR Corporation?

links.name: No, I didn't have any time. So you have ten minutes before we get there.
links.link: No, I didn't have any time. So you have ten minutes before we get there.

passages.name: Work’s work. Although I don't really like being kicked out of the conference. I really wanted to learn something new about this modern AI model.

passages.text:
- Heeell yeah. They work outside of our jurisdiction, so they are not afraid of anything. As it is now.

Saying that, Michael handed me a tablet.

[[Take the tablet from Michael's hands]]

links.name: Take the tablet from Michael's hands
links.link: Take the tablet from Michael's hands

passages.name: In general terms.Is it something about CAR Corporation?

passages.text:
- Okay, it will not be easy, but I'll guide you through the basics.

Michael handed me the tablet he has just been reading.

[[Take the tablet from Michael's hands]]

links.name: Take the tablet from Michael's hands
links.link: Take the tablet from Michael's hands

passages.name: No, I didn't have any time. So you have ten minutes before we get there.

passages.text:
Michael cleared his throat slightly.

- So, CAR corporation. It is engaged in any-purpose AI development. For any client. The Agency has been following one of their development teams based in Athens for the second year.

He flipped the page to the right, and a photo of a three-story building appeared on the screen. Apparently, it stood somewhere in the suburbs, and not too far from the sea.

- This is the main building. The office of developers, neurolabs and a small factory for manufacturing prototypes of devices for connecting with the brain and controlling technology through thought. And that's where I got you the invitation to. One of the directions of their development is the creation of online games, with the "Creator" system, you have probably heard something about that. AI creates and fills the world almost only by itself, and changes it when necessary.

[[Why Athens?]] 
[[So what? All I have to do is to complete another such game?]]

links.name: Why Athens?
links.link: Why Athens?

links.name: So what? All I have to do is to complete another such game?
links.link: So what? All I have to do is to complete another such game?

passages.name: Take the tablet from Michael's hands

passages.text:
- Good question. In Langley they assume that CAR's investment in the country's economy is just a well-disguised bribe. And the government just turns a blind eye to what is going on under their noses. We tried to make official requests to Greek intelligence, but received little information.

Michael leaned back in his chair.

- You are invited to the closed beta testing of their neurohelmet game. There will be ten testers, and as far as I know, they will be the best of the best.

[[So what? All I have to do is to complete another such game?]]

links.name: So what? All I have to do is to complete another such game?
links.link: So what? All I have to do is to complete another such game?

passages.name: Why Athens?

passages.text:
- You think Langley is full of idiots? AI is not always harmless, you know. And we have suspicions.

Michael raised his finger.

- Suspicions... That their "Game"  is just an intermediate or auxiliary project within a larger project.

[[I looked through the next page: "The Pallada Project?"]]

links.name: I looked through the next page: "The Pallada Project?"
links.link: I looked through the next page: "The Pallada Project?"

passages.name: So what? All I have to do is to complete another such game?

passages.text:
- Bingo.

Michael crossed his arms.

- There is not much information about the project. We could only find a few money transfers to the Athens branch with this comment. No information about the project, nor what it is intended for. And Uncle Sam doesn't like being kept from.

We were turning into the parking lot:

- In general, your task is to come to Athens, take part in testing, find out what they are actually developing, and report to us. Then  the task force will take matters into their  hands. It is now in Glyfada, which is about twenty minutes from Athens by car… And just in case of emergency...

He gave me a business card:

- Call this number. Use a payphone please, if possible. They will evacuate you from the peninsula. But this is for  the worst-case scenario only. We need to find out what's going on there. If we have evidence that they are doing something wrong, we can put a lot of pressure on them and on their customer, whoever it is.

The car stopped and the driver turned off the engine. I looked at my watch. There were ten minutes left before check-in started.

- If you have any questions, ask now. You'll be on your own for the next couple of weeks.

[[Do we know something about other testers?]] 
[[How do I contact you if there is something urgent?]] 
[[I'm not an agent, you know. What if shooting starts there?]] 
[[About evidence. What exactly should I look for?]] 
[[No more questions]]

links.link: Do we know something about other testers?

links.link: How do I contact you if there is something urgent?

passages.name: I looked through the next page: "The Pallada Project?"

passages.text:
- We know two more, they left San Francisco two days ago. Lindsey and Andrew Doubleday. Have you heard about them?

[[Yes, I remember something. AI to track fires in South America?]]

links.name: Yes, I remember something. AI to track fires in South America?
links.link: Yes, I remember something. AI to track fires in South America?

passages.name: Do we know something about other testers?

passages.text:
- No way. I told you, you'll be on your own. In the most extreme case, call us, we will get you out. We never leave a man behind, remember?

But you really need to find out what's really going on, so don't call just because you're scared.

[[Do we know something about other testers?]] 
[[I'm not an agent, you know. What if shooting starts there?]] 
[[About evidence. What exactly should I look for?]] 
[[No more questions]]

passages.text:
- It won't. We've been watching this place for quite some time, and there's no sign of strong security. Unless, of course, you consider guards with tasers a life threat.

[[Do we know something about other testers?]] 
[[How do I contact you if there is something urgent?]] 
[[About evidence. What exactly should I look for?]]

passages.name: I'm not an agent, you know. What if shooting starts there?

passages.text:
- Anything. Documents, files. data archives, access to servers, accounting information. If you're a hacker, you can even steal this Pallada project, whatever it is, and bring it to us. I might even get you a medal for this. Of course, you won’t be able to brag about that, you know.

Michael chuckled

- So, the more dirt on the CAR, the better. If you get something valuable, then we will reimburse the risks, but it’s better not to shove your head into a meat grinder on purpose.

[[Do we know something about other testers?]] 
[[How do I contact you if there is something urgent?]] 
[[I'm not an agent, you know. What if shooting starts there?]] 
[[No more questions]]

passages.text:
- That’s good.

He gave me an envelope with two tickets and three thousand dollars in it.

- I suppose your salary isn’t that bad already, but it's always nice to have vacation pay, right?

I took the envelope and automatically  counted the money. Michael chuckled.

-Recounted five times. No need to return, consider it a small gift from me.

[[I looked at Michael, and then at the terminal. On the scoreboard it’s said that the check-in for New York - Athens flight has already begun. "Well, thanks. Looks like I have to go."]]

links.name: I looked at Michael, and then at the terminal. On the scoreboard it’s said that the check-in for New York - Athens flight has already begun. "Well, thanks. Looks like I have to go."
links.link: I looked at Michael, and then at the terminal. On the scoreboard it’s said that the check-in for New York - Athens flight has already begun. "Well, thanks. Looks like I have to go."

passages.name: No more questions

passages.text:
- They are the best. Genius couple. We checked them, and they have recently dealt with the glacier melting rate problem. So, we believe  they are not your enemies. It's not even a fact that they know what kind of game is going on there, so keep your mouth shut.

Michael reached out and swiped a couple of times over the screen, showing a dossier on some terribly shaggy man with glasses.

- And this is Nakamoto Ishigami. He's an operative sent by Japanese intelligence. He's technically an ally, but it all depends on what you will find out. So you better keep your distance. Recently, Japan is clearly not averse to changing the current status Quo with the States.

[[How do I contact you if there is something urgent?]] 
[[I'm not an agent, you know. What if shooting starts there?]] 
[[About evidence. What exactly should I look for?]] 
[[No more questions]]

passages.name: Yes, I remember something. AI to track fires in South America?

passages.text:
- Looks like you do. Good luck and see you in a week!

He gave me an almost friendly pat on the shoulder and then I got out of the car. The driver immediately started the engine and pulled out of the parking lot. I was left alone with my task.

[[Go to the check-in counter]]

links.name: Go to the check-in counter
links.link: Go to the check-in counter

passages.name: I looked at Michael, and then at the terminal. On the scoreboard it’s said that the check-in for New York - Athens flight has already begun. "Well, thanks. Looks like I have to go."

passages.text:
It was quite crowded, and the feeling of an envelope in my pocket did not add confidence at all. While traveling, it is somewhat unreasonable to keep such an amount in cash.

I hope there is an ATM in Athens...

[[Give ticket and passport]]

links.name: Give ticket and passport
links.link: Give ticket and passport

passages.name: Go to the check-in counter

passages.text:
Standard procedure, passport check, stub torn-off, "Have a nice flight, Mr. Runner!", and then  the plane's airstairs.

I had only left the States a couple of times before that, at the request of the Agency, and then, these were more like on-the-spot consultations for real agents. They did the main work.

Prague, Moscow, Dubai. The latter I would not even mind visiting again outside of work but there was no time yet. That time, I had  to analyze the copy of the AI made by the group... Saber, I think?

[[Take your seat by the window and buckle up]]

links.name: Take your seat by the window and buckle up
links.link: Take your seat by the window and buckle up

passages.name: Give ticket and passport

passages.text:
I chuckled.

Then it was AI for the air defense system. Very advanced, by the way. They didn’t give it a test, but it seems that it could determine the angular velocity from the silhouette at a distance of 50 kilometers with an accuracy of a quarter of an arcminute...

Thoughts were interrupted by a slight gravity loss. The new model of Airtrain planes automatically extinguished all overloads

New York, the city that never sleeps, was shining with all its bright lights. Fireworks were heard somewhere, Independence Day was in full swing. Holiday picture.

The plane, meanwhile, reached cruising speed, and leveled off, quietly humming its engines in the wings.

It is still six hours to Athens, I  need to get some sleep...

[[Recline the chair and close eyes]]

links.name: Recline the chair and close eyes
links.link: Recline the chair and close eyes

passages.name: Take your seat by the window and buckle up

passages.text:
Tomorrow is the start of a busy week...

[[Nova Graecia...]]

links.name: Nova Graecia...
links.link: Nova Graecia...

passages.name: Recline the chair and close eyes

passages.text:
By the time the plane began to land, it was already a hot afternoon in Athens. I had ordered a large americano with sugar.

From a height, the city, even in such an era, seemed to be something very old, historical. There were no usual skyscrapers, very often there were two or three-story buildings, strangely curved streets, and in some places – ruins. Certainly some historical value.

By the time I finished my coffee, the plane had already touched down.

My head was  dizzy a little after an unusual place to sleep. Although compared to falling asleep right at the working table, it was much better.

Soon our plane parked and immediately, a leisurely fuss with pushing and falling bags began.

[[Leave the plane]]

links.name: Leave the plane
links.link: Leave the plane

passages.name: Nova Graecia...

passages.text:
It seems to be at least eighty degrees outside. I should find a shade as soon as possible.

Passport control again, a polite smile, and here I am in Greece. Amazing.

[[Find ATM]] 
[[Go to the airport exit]] 
[[Sit in the waiting area and take a good look around{{meet}}]]

links.link: Find ATM

links.link: Go to the airport exit

links.link: Sit in the waiting area and take a good look around{{meet}}

passages.name: Leave the plane

passages.text:
“Walking with cash is dangerous” , was the first thought in my head . Especially if it is so much

With that thought, I started looking for an ATM machine. Usually they are all located in a separate room, and this airport was no exception.

While the machine was confidently counting the cash and I was looking around, suddenly a man of Arab appearance and curly hair approached me.

- Miles Runner, is that you?

His English was quite good, though it had an Arabic accent.

[[Maybe. And you are?...]] 
[[Yes it's me]]

links.name: Maybe. And you are?...
links.link: Maybe. And you are?...

links.name: Yes it's me
links.link: Yes it's me

passages.name: Find ATM

passages.text:
At the exit, a taxi driver with a sign saying "Miles Runner" has already been waiting for me.

I approached the driver, said hello, and in a few minutes we were already leaving the airport parking lot.

This area of the city was quite new, but its architecture was also based on some old history. Some roofs were even made of shingles.

We were heading to the Grand Electra Hotel, where the rest of the testers were supposed to gather. I looked at my watch. The meeting should be in the evening, after six. I think that's what the briefing said.

While we were driving past one of the main streets, we noticed protesters on the right side. They were shouting something, but I didn’t speak Greek. The posters were eloquent. "No to robots!"

- Is it always like this?

- Every day - the taxi driver snorted. They are afraid that their jobs will be taken away. As if there is any good.

I tactfully kept silent. It looks like even CAR can't fix some things.

[[At the entrance to the hotel.]]

links.name: At the entrance to the hotel.
links.link: At the entrance to the hotel.

passages.name: Go to the airport exit

passages.text:
But there is absolutely no hurry. Especially since I need to recover after the flight.

No sooner said than done. Ten minutes later I was having lunch at the waiting area cafe. The prices weren't so outrageous.

Pancakes with nuts and honey are an interesting combination, I ate one after another with pleasure, watching people passing by. And the extra coffee was a great refresher after the flight.

While I was having lunch, more and more people arrived, most of the tables were occupied. I had already finished half my portion when a girl in a light beige business suit and short bright red hair entered the cafe hall.

She immediately went to the counter, ordered the same pancakes with a large mug of herbal tea, and was looking for a free place after ordering. When she had walked half a circle around the hall, she stopped and smiled slightly forcedly.

- Sorry. Don’t you mind?..

A strong Russian accent was a little bit off-putting, though not as much, after my Moscow adventures. I smiled politely.

[[Sure!]]

links.name: Sure!
links.link: Sure!

passages.name: Sit in the waiting area and take a good look around{{meet}}

passages.text:
— Saddam Darvish. We are competing for a large portion of baksheesh, if you know what I’m talking about… 

He winked. I have no idea what baksheesh is, but for show I laughed and put on my best smile

- Oh yes. You are testing games for Kinteco V3 neurohelmets, aren't you?

- Exactly

He smiled mischievously.

- Was it you who made a presentation yesterday in New York?

- Well, yes, I barely managed to get on the plane - saying that, I allowed myself to grin.

This Arab was friendly, that innate ingenuity!...
This conversation is a bargain rather than an attempt to make friends.

[[Have you arrived recently?]]

links.name: Have you arrived recently?
links.link: Have you arrived recently?

passages.name: Maybe. And you are?...

passages.text:
— Andrew Darvish. A tester. I was invited by CAR to participate in testing.

He held out his hand and I shook it as friendly as I could. So, he was one of my rivals, as I understood correctly.

I examined it a little more closely. Deep brown eyes, hooked nose, wide smile. And a T-shirt with a ten-year-old game printed on it. Such an interesting combination.

[[Have you arrived recently?]]

links.name: Have you arrived recently?
links.link: Have you arrived recently?

passages.name: Yes it's me

passages.text:
- Half an hour ago literally, by a flight from Abu Dhabi.

- That's it, is it? - I chuckled, and took the card from the ATM.

Andrew looked around, and then threw his arm around my shoulders.

- Listen, you're from America, aren't you? What about a small business?

[[I'm listening...]] 
[[Remove hand from shoulder.]]

links.name: I'm listening...
links.link: I'm listening...

links.name: Remove hand from shoulder.
links.link: Remove hand from shoulder.

passages.name: Have you arrived recently?

passages.text:
The lobby was not so crowded and comfortably cool. Perfect order was everywhere, CAR did not stint on good places for its employees.

I approached the receptionist, pointed out who I was, and after a couple of minutes I went with him in the elevator to the third floor

As we walked to the room, I looked around the corridor. The other nine participants were also supposed to live somewhere here, but it was quiet on the floor.

The receptionist opened the door for me and gave me the keys to the room:

- If you need anything, please call the hotel's internal number. Besides, Mr. Runner, I have been told that you are invited to dinner at our restaurant on the second floor. Should we prepare something special for you?

- Um .. I think not, the only thing is that it shouldn’t be  too spicy

The porter smiled knowingly.

- Anything you say. We will be waiting for you in the evening. Have a nice holiday!

The room was quite spacious, despite it was a studio.

Outside  was a great view of the sea. I would like to swim, of course, but it is unlikely to happen. And I still don't know who else I'll have to face.

With this thought, I fell on the bed and fell into an uneasy sleep under the noise of the trees in the yard. This jet lag is always confusing...

[[Evening of the same day. Hotel restaurant.]]

links.name: Evening of the same day. Hotel restaurant.
links.link: Evening of the same day. Hotel restaurant.

passages.name: At the entrance to the hotel.

passages.text:
-Here's the thing… I have a friend who works in Athens, and on his advice I participate, and if I can pass the testing, I can be invited to CAR. Savvy?

Mr. Darvish smiled slightly, and nodded, as if he understood what he was getting at.

-I listened to your speeches, and you seemed to be a real professional in matters of the work of neurons. So you can handle this testing as well. And I know some information about the internal kitchen of CAR. Knowledge is power, isn't it?

[[We might help each other indeed...{{deal}}]] 
[[Too unexpected risk. I'm not sure if I can answer right now.]]

links.name: We might help each other indeed...{{deal}}
links.link: We might help each other indeed...{{deal}}

links.name: Too unexpected risk. I'm not sure if I can answer right now.
links.link: Too unexpected risk. I'm not sure if I can answer right now.

passages.name: I'm listening...

passages.text:
- Unfortunately, I’m here only for the game testing. Nothing more. I don't need any adventures.

I smiled again, and Mr. Darvish nodded his head appreciatively.

- Well, yes, sure enough. So, I think I have to go, I have some small plans before we meet at the hotel. See you!

He shook my hand and went somewhere in the direction of the exit. It was a weird meeting.

[[Go to the airport exit]]

links.name: Go to the airport exit
links.link: Go to the airport exit

passages.name: Remove hand from shoulder.

passages.text:
- Thanks

This time it turned out almost without an accent. She sat down, and a couple of minutes later a plate of what was apparently her lunch was placed in front of her.

- Bon apetit - she said and began to eat her portion with obvious appetite

- Thank you .. - I smiled and continued to eat.

Surprisingly, she didn't smile. Russians generally have a frequent problem with a smile, as I managed to notice while being there. Pale blue eyes looked coldly around, sometimes for a moment stopping at me.

[[What is this dish? Is this something from the local cuisine?]]

links.name: What is this dish? Is this something from the local cuisine?
links.link: What is this dish? Is this something from the local cuisine?

passages.name: Sure!

passages.text:
My interlocutor smiled.

- I'm sure we'll beat the rest of the participants in no time and deal with each other, of course.

With these words, he patted my shoulder, and then took a couple of steps back.

- I have to go, I want to go somewhere before we all get together. Ghashufaq!

He waved to me and walked towards the exit of the airport. And I thought I had just agreed to something risky.

[[Go to the airport exit]]

links.name: Go to the airport exit
links.link: Go to the airport exit

passages.name: We might help each other indeed...{{deal}}

passages.text:
- I see you are a prudent fellow, brother.

Darvish smiled 32 teeth out, and carefully walked away.

- Well,  we'll see each other again if anything. Maybe we will manage to agree later. Good luck!

With these words, he firmly shook my hand and went to the exit. And I was standing next to the ATM for about a couple of minutes, wondering if this decision was the right one.


[[Go to the airport exit]]

links.name: Go to the airport exit
links.link: Go to the airport exit

passages.name: Too unexpected risk. I'm not sure if I can answer right now.

passages.text:
- I'm not sure..

Her cold eyes looked straight at me.

- I just chose what looked more substantial. And you?

I looked at my plate of pancakes

- It seems to be food prepared by a local recipe. But very sweet.

She seems to smile a little. I smiled back too, though I wasn't sure what that smile meant. After a few seconds, I collected my thoughts and continued eating:

- Are you in Athens on business?

She smiled again.

- Yes, I’m on my business trip ...

With these words, she quickly finished her dinner, quickly drank tea and got up from the table:

- Thanks for the company. Maybe see you again

- Everything is possible - I smiled again - By the way, what is your name?

- Ana. Ana Tikhomirova

- Tikho... Mirova. OK, I will remember. My name is Miles Runner, I'll be here for about a week.

-Me too. She smiled and held out her hand. I gently shook it, and then let go.

Ana went somewhere to the side, sometimes looking around, I followed her with my gaze for a while.

[[Go to the airport exit]]

links.name: Go to the airport exit
links.link: Go to the airport exit

passages.name: What is this dish? Is this something from the local cuisine?

passages.text:
I had a great sleep, so by the evening I was almost not late. I was wearing a wrinkled shirt and wide trousers, so I looked like some kind of tourist.
It was true to some extent.

The restaurant was not crowded, so I approached the administrator, and she quickly led me to the right table.

Six people were already sitting at the table. Among them I saw the Doubleday twins, a Japanese, obviously, he was Nakamoto Ishigami, whom Michael told me about. In addition, there was Avigdor Yaffe, a senior developer from Israel, whom I knew from reports on creating compact AI for a smart home.

- Nice to meet you!
- Me too, Mr. Runner. Your report on the reverse expansion of OLP-5 was extremely useful to me!

Andrew Darvish seems to have been a great flatterer. However, they are probably all the same.

After exchanging greetings, I sat down in my seat and waited for the rest. Jonathan Lee, the curator from CAR, was due to arrive soon. It seems that it was written on Michael's tablet that Lee is constantly moving between countries?

Lindsey Doubleday, a lively girl, immediately returned to her argument with Yaffe.

- I tell you again, this task is quite possible to solve with fewer resources, you just need to develop a small heuristic analysis of the threat in the model. We already did that.

Mr Yaffe shook his head uncertainty.

- The government, I already heard, tried. Nothing succeeded. And we are still at loggerheads with our neighbors ..

[[{{deal}} Give Darvish a little wink]] 
[[Join the argument.]]

links.name: {{deal}} Give Darvish a little wink
links.link: {{deal}} Give Darvish a little wink

links.name: Join the argument.
links.link: Join the argument.

passages.name: Evening of the same day. Hotel restaurant.

passages.text:
He winked back. Obviously, he was pretty well prepared for coming here. Michael didn't say anything about him, so for now it's worth assuming that he doesn't know what's going on here. At least for now.

I looked at the rest of the participants. The atmosphere was quite friendly, Mr. Jaffe listened with interest to Lindsey Doubleday's idea of how AI can help with the desert land problem. She gesticulated heavily, furiously proving that her project only looked complicated, but in reality a couple of dozen drones could cope with the task of controlling the area.

I was enjoying this lecture when four more people came up to the table.

-Ladies and gentlemen, thank you for being here. I'm Jonathan Lee and now I'm going to inform you in all details of what we'll be doing next week!

[[Look at the group of newcomers]]

links.name: Look at the group of newcomers
links.link: Look at the group of newcomers

passages.name: {{deal}} Give Darvish a little wink

passages.text:
I pulled the chair a little closer to the arguing.

- What are you talking about?

Lindsey immediately switched all her ardor to me:

- Oh, imagine, I have been explaining to this blockhead for twenty minutes that the problem of greening Israel is being solved in five years, if there is an appropriate AI that will control the greening.

- Hey... - Avigdor raised his hand in protest, but the girl immediately put her hand in front of him.

- Yes, I know, neighbors at loggerheads . But even so, you can come up with something to make the country better. Am I right, Mr. Runner?

- Well.. - I thought - I don't really understand the problems of protecting drones, to be honest, but it seems to me that AeroMach has made a new model of robots that can move at a speed of 2.5 times faster than the speed of sound. And besides this, they must support fifth-generation AI right on board. Shouldn't this be enough?

- Exactly!! Now you see! - she again turned to Mr. Yaffe - You can do anything, the main thing is to adapt to the situation correctly!

Jaffe was clearly confused by the ardor of the girl who bored him with her green eyes.

In the meantime, we did not notice how four more people came up to the table, and one of them quietly clapped his hands.

- My respects, Miss Doubleday. Rushing straight into battle.

A cold, tenacious look swept over everyone, including me. I got goosebumps.

- I'm Jonathan Lee, I'm the development manager for a new game from CAR Corporation. Today, ladies and gentlemen, we will make history!

[[Look at the group of newcomers]]

links.name: Look at the group of newcomers
links.link: Look at the group of newcomers

passages.name: Join the argument.

passages.text:
In addition to Mr. Lee himself, three men and one girl were seen in the approaching company. Judging by the appearance of one of them, he was from the British Isles. This accent is unmistakable.

They began to greet those who had already arrived. The Briton behaved with everyone politely, but slightly arrogantly, he introduced himself to everyone as Riley.

Next was a man with a rough voice who introduced himself to everyone as Jurgen. His confident handshake made my hand hurt a little.

The third was a Hindu named Ajitt Acharya. he warmly greeted everyone in the room, shook everyone's hand and kissed the palms of the ladies.It seemed to be Lindsey's taste.

Finally, the last was a girl who introduced herself as Ana Tikhomirova.

[[{{meet}}Look at the girl]] 
[[Wait for everyone to sit down{{spy}}]]

links.name: {{meet}}Look at the girl
links.link: {{meet}}Look at the girl

links.name: Wait for everyone to sit down{{spy}}
links.link: Wait for everyone to sit down{{spy}}

passages.name: Look at the group of newcomers

passages.text:
"Why is she here?",  flashed through my head.

I looked at them all. I have heard all the names before. All were notable figures in the world of AI creation, but she clearly did not fit into that category. How did she get here?

In the meantime everyone sat, and Mr. Lee diverted my attention.

So, ladies and gentlemen. - he spread his arms wide, as if hugging the audience - I'm glad that you are all here! You are the best of the best in the world of AI creation and we have been looking for you to make the perfect implementation of our new game - The Beauty of Battle! The gaming division of CAR has been diligently developing a new adaptive model for two years, which will allow you to maze players with new surprises every time. We have been testing every stage, and now the game is almost done.

Jurgen raised his hand.

- So if it is ready, then why do you need us?  The game already has its testers, hasn’t it?

- Great question! Yes, the game had highly qualified testers, and we brought the AI   to a near-perfect state. Despite that fact, we want to test what the game is capable with the best of the best. That's why you're here too - Lee smiled broadly, and then folded his palms as if in prayer - I hope you all enjoy your stay here, and enjoy working on our new brainchild. If you'd like to ask any questions, don't be shy! The first test will start tomorrow morning.

[[Maybe it would be easier to hire more testers? Hiring such professionals is expensive.]] 
[[How many stages will  be there in total?]] 
[[Could you tell us a little about the game itself?]] 
[[What will be our task?]] 
[[Any specific scenarios you are interested in?]] 
[[I have no questions]]

Or was it me,  who picked up paranoia from my CIA friends?

In the meantime everyone sat, and Mr. Lee diverted my attention.

So, ladies and gentlemen. - he spread his arms wide, as if hugging the audience - I'm glad that you are all here! - And how much do you need to go through, sir?

- Oh, you know, specifically in your case there will be five stages. It seems few, but in fact there will be many more of them. AI will build and rebuild the world, as in other games of our game developers.

- You know, it's easier to see it once in the deep dive mode. But I will tell you that the game has features that are both modern and something very ancient. For example... Hmm, no, it's still better to see. But believe me, the view will not disappoint you!

passages.text:
I raised my hand

- The game was probably tested before, and now they are testing it too. Maybe you should have hired more staff?

- The game already had a large number of testers, and they can no longer cope with what the AI is capable of without any restrictions. Therefore, we need people with a truly unconventional approach. Almost genius.

As he said this, Jonathan allowed himself a slight chuckle.

- Of course, this is a project with long-term consequences in the industry. Therefore, we are willing to pay for the best in order to get the best.

passages.text:
Before I could say anything, miss Doubleday raised her hand.

- What do we really need to do? The network must have gone through more than one development cycle!

- The same thing that all other players do. Finish the game. Naturally, it won't be that easy, especially at the end. But you're used to difficulties, aren't you?

I'll say even more, all who pass will receive half a million dollars, or its equivalent in any convenient currency, so you have even more motivation to pass it, don't you?

Lindsey had nothing to complain about, Mr. Lee's speech was cogent.

passages.name: What will be our task?

passages.text:
Jurgen raised his hand this time.

"Are we going to get any instructions, or do we have to rethink everything?"

Mr Lee smiled.

- You know, AI developers would probably tell you much more about this, but as far as I understood their explanations, they are just interested in how you will come to solve a particular problem. Perhaps this is how they look for flaws in their model.

The modern approach to development does not allow you to be limited just by written tests.

 Jurgen nodded and lowered his hand as a response.

[[Maybe it would be easier to hire more testers? Hiring such professionals is expensive.]]
