passages.text:
For a few moments silence braced the restaurant, only slightly disturbed by a soft pleasant melody.

Mr. Li realized that this was the end of all questions, he spread his arms slightly and solemnly said:

- Well, since that's all the questions for today, enjoy the excellent Greek cuisine. I'm glad you accepted our invitation!

And one more thing. Tomorrow at nine, I ask everyone to wait for me in the lobby, a car will already be waiting for us, which will take us directly to the office. Bon appetit and good evening!

With a warm farewell to everyone, Li left, and the atmosphere became almost festive. Miss Doubleday again entered into an already almost forgotten argument, Ishigami and Keville immediately dug into the mechanics of another hardcore fighting game, and Andrew and Jurgen seriously got on a discussion about the development of cryptography in the current conditions.

The rest, including me, just listened and enjoyed the evening.

[[Join conversation over dinner{{friends}}]] 
[[{{spy}} Finish your meal and go to your room.]]

links.name: Join conversation over dinner{{friends}}
links.link: Join conversation over dinner{{friends}}

links.name: {{spy}} Finish your meal and go to your room.
links.link: {{spy}} Finish your meal and go to your room.

passages.name: I have no questions

passages.text:
The topic of cryptography was close to me most of all, since I was a kind of security engineer.

With that thought, I moved closer to Andrew.

- Heuristic analysis of the algorithm is not a panacea. There are already quantum-resistant keys, and even the previous generation keys were hard enough to decrypt...

I joined this conversation by interjecting that I had already seen an AI that was able to pull off such a trick in less than a week. Mr. Horn nodded his head knowingly, AI analysts were already advanced enough in their development to win at least due to the speed of data processing.

Three hours later, the three of us were exhausted physically, but not morally, satisfied with the conversation. By this time, each of us began to disperse our rooms and I decided to do the same.

It was pleasantly cool on my floor, and I left the window ajar. An exceptionally good evening.

[[Go into the room, take off  clothes and fall exhausted]]

links.name: Go into the room, take off  clothes and fall exhausted
links.link: Go into the room, take off  clothes and fall exhausted

passages.name: Join conversation over dinner{{friends}}

passages.text:
For some reason, there was no desire to participate in all these disputes, so I quickly finished my meal, politely said goodbye to everyone, and then went to my room.

There was something wrong with all of this.

And this fear was immediately confirmed.

On the floor again stood that odd man from the restaurant. He was definitely not part of the hotel team. If so, how did he get in, and why is he hanging around here?

[[Try talking to the mysterious person]] 
[[Pretend not to notice and go to your room{{watchdog}}]]

links.name: Try talking to the mysterious person
links.link: Try talking to the mysterious person

links.name: Pretend not to notice and go to your room{{watchdog}}
links.link: Pretend not to notice and go to your room{{watchdog}}

passages.name: {{spy}} Finish your meal and go to your room.

passages.text:
Whatever you say,  the day was full of difficult moments. The guys are nice, of course, and there is something to talk about with them, but the thought that something bad might happen here still was annoying.

Michael would be better off wrong.

I slightly opened the curtains and the window. There was a full moon in the sky. It  illuminated the city, and the sea, by which it stretched. The view was amazing.

"At full moon, werewolves go hunting, according to legends…." - I thought and then chuckled at this thought.

Werewolves weren't real. The tales of ancient times have always exaggerated the real danger. And I probably did it too.

Having taken off all my clothes, I wrapped myself in a snow-white blanket, softly smelling of lavender, and quickly fell into a dream.

The real work starts tomorrow...

[[First day, first test]]

links.name: First day, first test
links.link: First day, first test

passages.name: Go into the room, take off  clothes and fall exhausted

passages.text:
It's worth a try.

I tried to approach the man, but before I could say anything, the light jacket turned a corner into another corridor.

After hesitating, I nevertheless followed, but when I reached the intersection in the corridor, I did not see a single hint that someone was here.

Was it paranoia indeed?

[[Go into the room, take off  clothes and fall exhausted]]

links.name: Go into the room, take off  clothes and fall exhausted
links.link: Go into the room, take off  clothes and fall exhausted

passages.name: Try talking to the mysterious person

passages.text:
Let's check.

I looked at my door and, walking just a little slower than usual, I watched the visitor out of the corner of my eye.

"Gotcha!..."

It was definitely spying. The principles of the agents' work knowledge nevertheless made itself felt. As soon as I made it clear to the man that they were not paying attention to him, a closer look immediately clung to me.

An unpleasant chill ran down my back, but I did my best not to show it.

Looks like I'm already hooked. Or we are all hooked. The only question is why?

[[Go into the room, take off  clothes and fall exhausted]]

links.name: Go into the room, take off  clothes and fall exhausted
links.link: Go into the room, take off  clothes and fall exhausted

passages.name: Pretend not to notice and go to your room{{watchdog}}

passages.text:
I opened my eyes. Reality in reality, if you can call it that.

Exactly at nine, we all were on the bus, in half an hour we got to the main office of CAR, and then sitting in reclining chairs, connected to Hi-End neurohelmets.

We, ten of us, stood in a quite narrow but long corridor. The corridor entrance itself was covered with an iron grate. Archaic.

- Well, are you all ready for an adventure? Lindsey yelled happily. Some supported her enthusiasm with a slight grin, while others, on the other hand, focused intently on what is going to happen next.

Among them was me.

[[-Bright-faced warrior...]]

links.name: -Bright-faced warrior...
links.link: -Bright-faced warrior...

passages.name: First day, first test

passages.text:
A girl with fair, almost white skin, cold brown eyes and a high Greek nose was standing by the grate. Her stubborn lips were compressed and her chin held up proudly.

The body was covered with a blue dress. On her hands were silver bracers, and in her hands was a light machine gun.

- Greetings, warriors. - her voice was not very loud, but at the same time very clear and confident - are you eager to challenge the gods?

Obviously we have to agree.

I quickly took a step forward:

- Yes, I want to challenge!

- And I! Lindsey shouted cheerfully.

"So do we," Jurgen and Andrew Doubleday said calmly.

Her face didn't change. She looked at everyone present one by one and closed her eyes.

- May it be so. Go ahead and show that you can rise to the skies.

With these words, the grate rose above us, and ten of us went forward, towards the light.

And the warrior said to us after:

- And remember, you are challenging your own strengths.

[[Great Arena]]

links.name: Great Arena
links.link: Great Arena

passages.name: -Bright-faced warrior...

passages.text:
After passing the corridor  in about half a minute, bright sunlight hit my eyes. I closed my eyes, a pleasant salty smell hit my nose.

Sea breeze.

Once my eyes adjusted, I involuntarily sighed. Before us was the sea. Tribunes spread out on the sides of us without end and without edge, and in the sky ...

- It seems to me alone that the developers went over a little on a grand scale? Riley Cavill drawled slowly.

Before us opened a tower to heaven. The platform, huge as the sea itself, stretched over him, slowly revolving, and a beam of light hit somewhere in the expanse of the sea

[[Look around for a boat]] 
[[Anyone have any idea what to do?{{rival}}]]

links.name: Look around for a boat
links.link: Look around for a boat

links.name: Anyone have any idea what to do?{{rival}}
links.link: Anyone have any idea what to do?{{rival}}

passages.name: Great Arena

passages.text:
- Looks like we need to get there.

Saying this, I noticed a long pier with ten boats. Our ticket to the next level.

Rushing ahead of everyone, I jumped into the wheelhouse a few seconds before the nearest boat. It was an armored military boat. It had several turrets with heavy machine guns, depth charges, a couple of torpedoes...

If all this is necessary for the game, then what will you have to fight?

[[Key to start]]

links.name: Key to start
links.link: Key to start

passages.name: Look around for a boat

passages.text:
- I think everything is obvious! We just need to get to that pillar of light, and then we'll figure out what to do.

Cavill rushed somewhere to the shore. Suddenly I realized that there was a dock and ten boats were moored to it, each for one person.

We all ran there. In no case did not want to lose to this overly quick kid. He may have been a player, but he certainly wasn't a developer. And why did he give up CAR?

Running aboard the first free boat, I jumped into the cockpit.

[[Key to start]]

links.name: Key to start
links.link: Key to start

passages.name: Anyone have any idea what to do?{{rival}}

passages.text:
There is no time to think. The sooner I figure this out, the sooner I'll understand what's going on.

The engine howled sharply at high speeds, I backed up, and immediately gave the rudder to the right, sharply leaning on board.

Need to get away from the rest.

[[Put on AR glasses]]

links.name: Put on AR glasses
links.link: Put on AR glasses

passages.name: Key to start

passages.text:
The boat was stuffed with electronics, which I took advantage of.

On the left, in a special mount, were the reality glasses that I put on myself.

The cockpit walls became almost transparent, and the combat interface immediately appeared.

Initialization
Machine gun turrets .. ready
Depth charges..ready
Torpedo tubes 1 and 2 .. ready
Harpoon..ready
Sonar..active

Immediately after that, I looked around. There was no one around. I couldn't be that far off.

Suddenly, a red screen appeared on the right:
Test started. Choose Limiters!

Reaction limit
Ammo limit
travel speed limit
Drill strength limit
Disable underwater mines

Choose one to exclude.

[[Exclude reaction limit{{slowbrain}}]] 
[[Exclude travel speed limit{{slowspeed}}]] 
[[Remove ammo limit{{ammo}}]] 
[[Exclude underwater mines{{mines}}]] 
[[Remove drill durability limit{{drill}}]]

links.name: Exclude reaction limit{{slowbrain}}
links.link: Exclude reaction limit{{slowbrain}}

links.name: Exclude travel speed limit{{slowspeed}}
links.link: Exclude travel speed limit{{slowspeed}}

links.name: Remove ammo limit{{ammo}}
links.link: Remove ammo limit{{ammo}}

links.name: Exclude underwater mines{{mines}}
links.link: Exclude underwater mines{{mines}}

links.name: Remove drill durability limit{{drill}}
links.link: Remove drill durability limit{{drill}}

passages.name: Put on AR glasses

passages.text:
- Most likely, this is a limitation for combat intelligence ...

If the goal was to test it, I would start with this. But, since you need to get through quickly, then let it fight in full force!

Having chosen an unnecessary limiter, I switched to sonar and, having slowed down, prepared to listen carefully ...

[[Something is wrong...]]

links.name: Something is wrong...
links.link: Something is wrong...

passages.name: Exclude reaction limit{{slowbrain}}

passages.text:
- Maneuver rules the sea, but if the test is delayed, then I will not be ahead of everyone.

After removing the limiter, I switched to sonar and began to zigzag closer to the light source, which was the destination.

[[Something is wrong...]]

links.name: Something is wrong...
links.link: Something is wrong...

passages.name: Exclude travel speed limit{{slowspeed}}

passages.text:
- In general, even if the ammunition is limited, this does not mean that there are none at all ..

Keeping this in mind, I decided to remove the ammo limit, hoping that no matter what awaited me, ammo has a habit of running out.

After confirming my choice and switching to sonar, I accelerated quickly and rode forward, hoping to find what I was looking for before it found me.

[[Something is wrong...]]

links.name: Something is wrong...
links.link: Something is wrong...

passages.name: Remove ammo limit{{ammo}}

passages.text:
- Mines? Or maybe you will immediately shoot me from large-caliber artillery ??

I didn't know much about ships, but the mines sounded too dangerous to leave at sea. So I decided to remove them.

Having confirmed the choice, I switched to machine guns and gave full speed slightly away from the light.

[[Something is wrong...]]

links.name: Something is wrong...
links.link: Something is wrong...

passages.name: Exclude underwater mines{{mines}}

passages.text:
- Hmm... I have no idea what a drill is, but I won't let anyone close to me!

Turning off this limitation, I looked at the column of light with the help of magnification. He hit a small sandy island. Looks like that's where I need to be.

Turning the engines on at half power, I headed straight for it, expecting an attack at any moment.

[[Something is wrong...]]

links.name: Something is wrong...
links.link: Something is wrong...

passages.name: Remove drill durability limit{{drill}}

passages.text:
It took just a couple of minutes, as the engine suddenly stalled, and part of the systems cut off.

What the hell happened now?

I looked around the water surface, there was no one around. But the boat couldn't break so easily...

[[Exit the cockpit and look around again]]
[[Try to start engine]]

links.name: Exit the cockpit and look around again
links.link: Exit the cockpit and look around again

links.name: Try to start engine
links.link: Try to start engine

passages.name: Something is wrong...

passages.text:
I've already been attacked. But until I understand who, there will be little sense from any actions.

With this thought, I left the cockpit of the boat and again examined the water surface, a pillar of light in the distance

There was a splash behind me, and I whirled around. There was nothing. At one point, I already decided that it seemed like it, when suddenly ...

A shining metal robot in the shape of a dolphin abruptly jumped out of the water. Its forehead was decorated with a drill, two compartments were visible on its sides, and its back

Like a blind that's just opened.

Dozens of bombs flew out of the back with sharp pops, and the whole sky was covered with black dots. Everything happened as if in slow motion.

- Cripes!!-

[[Quickly jump back into the cockpit]]

links.name: Quickly jump back into the cockpit
links.link: Quickly jump back into the cockpit

passages.name: Exit the cockpit and look around again

passages.text:
I’ve gotta get out of here as quick as possible.

I grabbed the ignition key and tried to start the engine. The starter cranked it several times, but to no avail.

Out of anger, I hit the dashboard with all my might, cursing the piece of iron, when suddenly the entire hull of the boat trembled slightly.

"Attention, damage to the armor of the bow, gap rick!"

The ship's system was screaming of danger, tugging at his nerves. I activated the sonar again and this time I saw... Fish?

[[Drop the depth charge]]
[[Try to start the boat again]]

links.name: Drop the depth charge
links.link: Drop the depth charge

links.name: Try to start the boat again
links.link: Try to start the boat again

passages.name: Try to start engine

passages.text:
The enemy noticed that he was seen, and immediately dived under the boat, fleeing from shelling. But I didn't mean to shoot.

Instead, I immediately pressed the reset of the depth charges. Six bombs immediately went into the water, filling the space under the bottom with an explosive mixture, just about ready to explode.

[[{{slowspeed}}Start the boat quickly before the bombs go off]]
[[Prepare to launch the harpoon]]

links.name: {{slowspeed}}Start the boat quickly before the bombs go off
links.link: {{slowspeed}}Start the boat quickly before the bombs go off

links.name: Prepare to launch the harpoon
links.link: Prepare to launch the harpoon

passages.name: Drop the depth charge

passages.text:
"Fish" furiously fought against the side, as if in convulsions, metal gnashed in the air.

This is the enemy, we must break the distance, but quickly.

I pulled the key again, and this time the engine growled obediently.

The robot, noticing that the target was moving again, tried to sneak away somewhere to the right and back from the boat.

[[Fire burst with heavy machine guns]]
[[{{slowspeed}}Drop a depth charge and give it a gas in the hope of getting off]]

links.name: Fire burst with heavy machine guns
links.link: Fire burst with heavy machine guns

links.name: {{slowspeed}}Drop a depth charge and give it a gas in the hope of getting off
links.link: {{slowspeed}}Drop a depth charge and give it a gas in the hope of getting off

passages.name: Try to start the boat again

passages.text:
I obviously didn't understand naval combat, but machine guns work everywhere, right?

Switching control to them, I gave the right steering wheel, sharply wrapping in the direction of the target.

It looked like it was preparing for a counterattack, and I immediately fired several bursts of coaxial machine guns.

- Come, come here....

[[Prepare to launch the harpoon]]

links.name: Prepare to launch the harpoon
links.link: Prepare to launch the harpoon

passages.name: Fire burst with heavy machine guns

passages.text:
I switched to bomb release, set the minimum timer and pushed the throttle all the way forward. The engine roared, and the stern plant dropped four small bombs after the boat.

New sonar scan. The robot is following right behind me. Moment of truth!

[[{{slowspeed}}You can't overshoot!!]]

links.name: {{slowspeed}}You can't overshoot!!
links.link: {{slowspeed}}You can't overshoot!!

passages.name: {{slowspeed}}Drop a depth charge and give it a gas in the hope of getting off

passages.text:
In spite of my screams, the fish went through the bomb fence with surprising ease. A couple of moments - and she slipped forward, moving a little to the side and intending to counterattack.

[[Open suppression fire]]
[[{{slowspeed}}Try to lasso a robot with a harpoon]]

links.name: Open suppression fire
links.link: Open suppression fire

links.name: {{slowspeed}}Try to lasso a robot with a harpoon
links.link: {{slowspeed}}Try to lasso a robot with a harpoon

passages.name: {{slowspeed}}You can't overshoot!!

passages.text:
She can't turn around. She won't rest until she sinks the boat. So I have to defeat her first!

Switching to the turrets, I sharply pressed the fire button, and the machine guns roared into two large-caliber barrels. Heavy bullets began to fall into the water in a hail, I did not spare the cartridges, just to prevent the enemy from making the next move.

The fish wiggled, dodging the attacks.

{{ammo}}[[{{ammo}}Clap the fish on the mines]]
[[Prepare to launch the harpoon]]

links.name: {{ammo}}Clap the fish on the mines
links.link: {{ammo}}Clap the fish on the mines

links.name: Prepare to launch the harpoon
links.link: Prepare to launch the harpoon

passages.name: Open suppression fire

passages.text:
Now I regret that I removed the speed limiter.

The fish, apparently turned out to be a narwhal, dived sharply under the water at the moment when the harpoon flew at it. Grunting in displeasure, I quickly switched to depth charges and floated over the place where it should surface.

Several shells exploded one after the other. I checked the sonar as the water subsided. As if nothing had happened, the fish turned around and again walked towards me.

- You can choke on it, rubbish! ..

Dropping another bomb, I gave up and got ready for another run

[[Try to launch a torpedo]]

links.name: Try to launch a torpedo
links.link: Try to launch a torpedo

passages.name: {{slowspeed}}Try to lasso a robot with a harpoon

passages.text:
It looks like the fish was fast, but not too smart. Wagging its tail, it didn't even notice how it drove herself into a minefield.

There were two terrible explosions that raised a huge column of water. This should be enough.

Sharply moving forward and to the left, I banked to the island, not forgetting to check what was going on under the water.Hardly was it the only enemy.

[[Sail to the island, and leave the boat on the shore]]

links.name: Sail to the island, and leave the boat on the shore
links.link: Sail to the island, and leave the boat on the shore

passages.name: {{ammo}}Clap the fish on the mines

passages.text:
This time luck is on my side. The engine started on the first try, and I quickly decided to leave the dangerous place.

A few seconds passed, and a small rainbow formed from behind, the bombs exploded in the depths, raising a whole fountain of spray.

It would be beautiful, but this robot will not leave until it sinks the boat. You need to sink it first, no matter what.

Again active sonar, again carefully examine the stern. Here it is!

It doesn't look like it was hurt at all after the attack. The target was fast approaching.

[[Prepare to launch the harpoon]]

links.name: Prepare to launch the harpoon
links.link: Prepare to launch the harpoon

passages.name: {{slowspeed}}Start the boat quickly before the bombs go off

passages.text:
The robot, instead of going under water, for some reason decided that it could defeat me in an open confrontation. All the better.

Switching to the harpoon, I carefully waited for the moment when he would be in the affected area.

Six hundred yards, five hundred... Four hundred...

- START!

The jet harpoon whistled sharply through the air, and crashed into the water surface. A second - and the launcher confirmed the capture.

- Gotcha, bastard!

[[Launch a torpedo at the enemy]]
[[{{drill}}Fire machine guns]]

links.name: Launch a torpedo at the enemy
links.link: Launch a torpedo at the enemy

links.name: {{drill}}Fire machine guns
links.link: {{drill}}Fire machine guns

passages.name: Prepare to launch the harpoon

passages.text:
The robot, most like a unicorn dolphin, tried to sprint away from the boat, intending to break the harpoon cable with brute force.

- I will not let it...

The torpedo guidance system was already at the ready. Five seconds to scan the target - Narwhal Mk.2

Open container
Raise the fuse.

- Start!

I pressed the start button all the way, and the torpedo went towards the fish. She pulled the cable with all her might, but I only reversed slightly, so as not to follow her lead, but also not to break the connection.

Ten seconds passed, then twenty...

A column of water rose into the air, along with pieces of skin, something that looked like a tail flew off to the side.

- Even if it’s still twitching, it obviously won’t be able to continue chasing..

Thinking so, I gave a slight  forward, and swam straight to the island

[[Sail to the island, and leave the boat on the shore]]

links.name: Sail to the island, and leave the boat on the shore
links.link: Sail to the island, and leave the boat on the shore

passages.name: Launch a torpedo at the enemy

passages.text:
Wrong move. The enemy dived under the water to escape the bullets.

The account went for seconds, something urgently needs to be done.

But the enemy did not give time to think. This time, the robot desperately attacked the stern of the ship, hiding from the fire of the turret, and tearing off the harpoon from itself.

The screech of metal came very close, hot sparks hitting the deck.

"Propulsion system damaged,proceeding diagnostic..."

Damn it, this is more PvP than PvE...

One more such call and the ship will go to the bottom.

[[Drop a torpedo and a depth charge after it]]

links.name: Drop a torpedo and a depth charge after it
links.link: Drop a torpedo and a depth charge after it

passages.name: {{drill}}Fire machine guns

passages.text:
Отчаянные времена, отчаянные действия.

Можно подорвать торпеду под кормой, и понадеяться, что я смогу доплыть.

- Сброс торпед один и два!

Контейнеры по бортам открыли свои крышки, и выплюнули торпеды в воду. Цель не была задана, так что торпеды просто медленно пошли ко дну. То что нужно.

Я втопил кнопку сброса бомб до конца, и аппаратт на корме сбросил оставшийся боезапас. Взрыв должен быть громким. 

Прошло десять секунд. Резкий хлопок в ушах, и затем ужасная боль. Корму катера слегка подбросило от взрыва...

Я взялся за уши и почувствовал что-то горячее. Посмотрев на ладони, я понял, что они все в моей крови..

- Хорошо, что это только игра, да, Майлз?...

Боль была невыносимая, но пора было двигаться дальше. Заведя двигатель где-то с десятой попытки, я, нетвердо стоя на ногах, отправился к острову.

[[Reach the shore and fall on the warm sand.]]

links.name: Reach the shore and fall on the warm sand.
links.link: Reach the shore and fall on the warm sand.

passages.name: Drop a torpedo and a depth charge after it

passages.text:
There is no choice, machine guns do not reach her, bombs are too slow

It was decided that a volley of torpedoes should be fired.

A few seconds of sonar work, and the target was scanned, Narwhal Mk.2, torpedoes were aimed ...

- Start, start, start!

Both torpedoes flew out of their containers, and immediately left after the fish, which managed to detect the launch.

[[Get full speed while running away from the attack]]

links.name: Get full speed while running away from the attack
links.link: Get full speed while running away from the attack

passages.name: Try to launch a torpedo

passages.text:
The robot went on a suicide attack.

Sonar detected a torpedo launch. Looks like this is the weapon that knocked me out in the first place.

Quickly turning to the right of the rudder, I ran in zigzags from the torpedo, unable to stop it, one to the left, two to the right, full speed, low speed ..

Literally five meters away, first one small explosion was heard, and then two large ones, raising a whole fountain of water. I checked the sonar. Lots of noise in the water. Wreckage...

After a couple of seconds, the back of the narwhal appeared on the surface. I looked out of the cockpit to see the robot live.

It didn't move.

- It looks like I got it, a piece of iron! ...

With these words, some hatches opened on the back of the narwhal. Feeling unkind, I immediately jumped back into the cockpit. And not in vain.

Glass shattered everywhere. Dozens of small bombs were fired into the sky, and then deadly shrapnel covered everything around.

The sharp pain in my back made me want to scream furiously.

- B-bastard!!

For a couple more minutes lying like this, I waited for another rain of fragments, but this did not happen. Surely this was the last trump card, right?

I felt my back. Two fragments stuck somewhere in the area of the shoulder blades. Even moving hurts. We need to leave here.

Putting on my glasses again, I slowed down and, using the map on the screen, gently swam towards the island.

- To hell with those games. They are already trying to kill me...

[[Reach the shore and fall on the warm sand.]]

links.name: Reach the shore and fall on the warm sand.
links.link: Reach the shore and fall on the warm sand.

passages.name: Get full speed while running away from the attack

passages.text:
Without any second thought, I jumped back under the boat's armor. And it obviously saved my life.

Fireworks crackled outside, and a hail of shrapnel hit the deck. Several windows in the cockpit cracked, and one even flew out, scattering the glass on the floor.

As soon as the roar and ringing subsided, I immediately jumped up and ran to the steering wheel. Need to cut the claws.

[[Start engine]]

links.name: Start engine
links.link: Start engine

passages.name: Quickly jump back into the cockpit

passages.text:
The ship's systems seem to have recovered from the surprise attack. Two attempts - and the boat moves again.

I put the AR glasses back on and turned on the active sonar. The creature swam parallel to me, clearly trying to figure out if I was alive. As soon as the screw was untwisted, the movements of this "dolphin" changed dramatically. It was on an interception course.

{{slowspeed}}[[{{slowspeed}}Stop abruptly]]
[[Turn around and go to the frontal]]

links.name: {{slowspeed}}Stop abruptly
links.link: {{slowspeed}}Stop abruptly

links.name: Turn around and go to the frontal
links.link: Turn around and go to the frontal

passages.name: Start engine

passages.text:
You won't be able to leave. But, maybe it will be possible to deceive this fish?

With this thought, I abruptly stopped the engine, and the boat rocked slightly in the waves. Sonar I also turned off, and switched to depth charges.

- If it does, I'll just blow it up right there.

Without taking off my glasses, I quickly climbed onto the deck. badly shattered by shrapnel.

Now it all depends on how fast she gets here...

[[Hidden and wait]]
[[Wait half a minute. and enable active sonar]]

links.name: Hidden and wait
links.link: Hidden and wait

links.name: Wait half a minute. and enable active sonar
links.link: Wait half a minute. and enable active sonar

passages.name: {{slowspeed}}Stop abruptly

passages.text:
An attempt to murder cannot be forgiven.

Rudder briskly to the right, and here we go head-on at each other. I gave full speed ahead, preparing to solve everything with one decisive blow.

- Let's see whose nerves are IRON ..

[[{{drill}}Launch both torpedoes at the fish]]
[[Rudder sharply to the left and release the bombs just before the collision]]

links.name: {{drill}}Launch both torpedoes at the fish
links.link: {{drill}}Launch both torpedoes at the fish

links.name: Rudder sharply to the left and release the bombs just before the collision
links.link: Rudder sharply to the left and release the bombs just before the collision

passages.name: Turn around and go to the frontal

passages.text:
- Calm down .. - I whispered to myself - the prey itself comes to me ...

Several painful minutes passed and I already thought that I would not see my target, but then a shiny back flashed behind and to the left of the stern of the boat.

- Fine, come here...

The bombs were set on the lowest possible fuse. Of course, it was dangerous to use them off the go, but the risk was worth it.

A few more seconds, and the robo-fish reappeared next to the boat, already directly astern.

There is no better time to think of.

[[Release bombs]]
[[Release the harpoon and then release the bombs and go full speed]]

links.name: Release bombs
links.link: Release bombs

links.name: Release the harpoon and then release the bombs and go full speed
links.link: Release the harpoon and then release the bombs and go full speed

passages.name: Hidden and wait

passages.text:
Big chances are never small!

After waiting for a while, I switched to sonar. The sound wave traveled through the water, revealing the position of the robot.

It slowed down and this time was enough to analyze and make a decision.

A sharp turn, a gap in the distance, and it again goes to me. I started the engine, and immediately followed it, sharply laying the boat on its side.

It looks like a real duel has begun.

[[Prepare to launch the harpoon]]

links.name: Prepare to launch the harpoon
links.link: Prepare to launch the harpoon

passages.name: Wait half a minute. and enable active sonar

passages.text:
Now!

I gave the command, and the craft at the stern fired four small projectiles.

- Gotcha!

The shells went under the water, and the metal back dived sharply, floating away somewhere to the left.

A few seconds, and  a cascade of explosions was under water. There was no point in hiding anymore and I turned on the sonar. The fish went somewhere to the side, despite the fact that it had a slow reaction, it had as much speed as it wanted. And I chose this method myself ..

I quickly ran back into the cockpit and started the engine. There was no point in hiding anymore, it was time to start an open battle...

[[Fire burst with heavy machine guns]]

links.name: Fire burst with heavy machine guns
links.link: Fire burst with heavy machine guns

passages.name: Release bombs

passages.text:
No, she's too fast. One bomb is not enough.

I glanced again at the shiny back that swam in circles around the boat.

The harpoon was loaded, and since the target doesn't know I'm alive...

The harpoon mount slowly turned towards the target, a couple of seconds, a deep breath, a missed heartbeat...

- Start!

A sharp bang, and the harpoon dug with all its might right in the middle of the robot's body. There was a sharp splash, prey on the hook.

Now the second part. Before my adversary tried to run away or do something to the cable, I started the engine and went full throttle, pulling the cable with me. Sonar active again, target scanned

- Narwhal Mk.2...

It was something familiar. But it doesn't matter.

Before the fish had time to come to their senses, I launched depth charges and dragged the narwhal right at them. He struggled to break free, but the harpoon lodged unexpectedly deep in his back. A second - and an explosion was heard in the water.

The cable suddenly loosened, and automatically pulled back. I looked back, there was no debris anywhere. Although...

The rescan showed a lot of noise. The wreckage went to the bottom. From the experience, the knees trembled slightly from the tension.

-Damn. Not another foot in the water...

[[Sail to the island, and leave the boat on the shore]]

links.name: Sail to the island, and leave the boat on the shore
links.link: Sail to the island, and leave the boat on the shore

passages.name: Release the harpoon and then release the bombs and go full speed

passages.text:
- Все или ничего!...

Я включил систему наведения, и быстро просканировал цель. Нарвал Mk.2

Скоро будет Mk.0

Торпедные аппараты готовы к запуску. Крышки контейнеров открылись и резко выплюнули в воду две продолговатые трубы с гребным винтом позади.

Они настигнут ее быстрее, чем я.

Прибавив ходу, я резко ушел в сторону острова. Результат битвы был предрешен.

По крайней мере так казалось.

Через полминуты обе торпеды взорвались совсем близко от катера. Меня явно преследовали. Я уже думал о том, стоит ли сбрасывать бомбы, как вдруг резкий скрежет металла раздался прямо подо мной. Еще секунда, и пол подо мной разверся, и быстро вращающийся бур пробил стойку с приборами.

Послышался аварийный сигнал. Я резко отпрыгунул, и тут же почувствовал боль в левой ноге. Она была вся в крови, непонятно как, но этот нарвал меня достал...

Через пару минут бур прекратил вращаться и крушить все вокруг, а затем медленно пошел вниз. Я посмотрел в дыру, которую проделал мой враг, и увидел, что робот был явно очень сильно поврежден. Это была его последняя отчаянная атака.

- Но все таки он меня достал...

Катер постепенно начал набирать воду. Нужно доплыть до острова до того, как он пойдет ко дну вслед за неприятелем...

[[Reach the shore and fall on the warm sand.]]

links.name: Reach the shore and fall on the warm sand.
links.link: Reach the shore and fall on the warm sand.

passages.name: {{drill}}Launch both torpedoes at the fish

passages.text:
- Come here, iron-thing...

We got closer and closer. There were less than four hundred yards left, then three hundred, two hundred

Now or never. I launched half of my bombs into the water, and ruddered sharply to the left, leaving a frontal attack.

At the same time, the robot did not have time to react, and flew right into the trap. There was a whole salute of explosions, raising a bunch of spray, and a light rainbow, and I sighed in relief. My heart was pounding, and I took deep breaths, trying to stop the trembling all over my body.

- This is probably how real soldiers feel when they return from battle ...

Having hardly calmed down, I made sure that there was no more pursuit for me, and turned towards the island. I don’t know how long the battle went on, but it’s definitely time to end.

[[Sail to the island, and leave the boat on the shore]]

links.name: Sail to the island, and leave the boat on the shore
links.link: Sail to the island, and leave the boat on the shore

passages.name: Rudder sharply to the left and release the bombs just before the collision

passages.text:
The fight was very short, but it made the tension even more powerful.

Having somehow brought the boat to the beach, I stopped the engine, and, barely moving my feet, went to the exit.

Even though I was wearing boots, the feeling of sea water and solid ground clearly did me good.

The adrenaline that had been released after the battle began to fade, and I felt very tired. Without thinking twice, I reached a place where the tide does not reach, and, exhausted, lay back on the warm sand.

It was light all around, but the hulk of the next arena hung over me. It seems that we were told that there will be five of them ... But I'm not sure anymore that I want to go further.

- It's not a job for me. They should have hired sailors or something. There is no time for analysis and tests at all ..

[[Lay still for a couple of minutes, then get up and go to the center of the island]]

links.name: Lay still for a couple of minutes, then get up and go to the center of the island
links.link: Lay still for a couple of minutes, then get up and go to the center of the island

passages.name: Reach the shore and fall on the warm sand.

passages.text:
It was dangerous, but also exciting. If this level was invented by AI, then you need to pay tribute to CAR - they outdid themselves. I haven't felt such immersion in a long time.

Jumping off the boat, I felt a light sea breeze. It pleasantly relaxed after a tense fight.

But there is no time to cool off. In the center of the island, something like a huge mirror was visible in the middle of ancient ruins. Looks like it's the next step

[[Head straight to the ruins]]

links.name: Head straight to the ruins
links.link: Head straight to the ruins

passages.name: Sail to the island, and leave the boat on the shore

passages.text:
I closed my eyes, took a deep breath. The main thing is, I did it. I've dealt with this, and I'll deal with the rest.

- You gotta get up...

Carefully getting up from the sand, I looked around and saw ancient ruins in the middle of the island. And inside these ruins was... A mirror? And huge!

Looks like this is my ticket out of here.

[[Head straight to the ruins]]

links.name: Head straight to the ruins
links.link: Head straight to the ruins

passages.name: Lay still for a couple of minutes, then get up and go to the center of the island

passages.text:
Five minutes later I reached the ruins.

As soon as I stepped onto the first step, the atmosphere changed dramatically, the columns were covered with vines, and here and there trees and grass sprouted. It's like nature rewinds time itself.

- Hey, slowpoke, catch up, we are waiting for you!

ГLindsey Doubleday sounded cheerful and waved at me. It looks like the job was easy for her. She chirped cheerfully about something with her brother, and gesticulated strongly, showing either explosions, or how she grabbed the steering wheel, or something else.

Everyone else was here too. Henry Cavill came out of the fight unscathed, which was not the case for Jurgen, who was holding on to his riddled left arm. Looks like he got caught by shrapnel.

The rest also had minor injuries, but in general, everyone passed this level. Which was already great.

I was about to get involved in the discussion when the calm voice of a warrior woman was heard from behind our company

- Warriors, you showed yourself worthy! But the way to the top is far, don't forget about it.

She extended her left hand gracefully like a ballerina and pointed her fingers at the mirror.

- Go, glory awaits you. I will accompany you on this path, no matter what happens.

The NPC was made almost lifelike. Maybe he was, in some way?

But we will all discuss this later.

[[AI stranger things]]

links.name: AI stranger things
links.link: AI stranger things

passages.name: Head straight to the ruins

passages.text:
7 July 203X

Grand Electra Hotel

Yesterday we passed the second arena, and we all gathered together to celebrate this in a restaurant.

- Honestly, I don't understand why they needed us .. - Jurgen rubbed his chin thoughtfully. - The AI doesn't look too advanced.

- So we were told that he works under restrictions, didn't he? - Mr. Acharya thoughtfully said, winding pasta on his fork - After all, we do not have to confront the AI in its full force. Will he be better than us?


[[{{deal}} Look at Darvish and slightly nod your head to the side, inviting you to move away]]
[[- I thought he was acting weird.]]

links.name: {{deal}} Look at Darvish and slightly nod your head to the side, inviting you to move away
links.link: {{deal}} Look at Darvish and slightly nod your head to the side, inviting you to move away

links.name: - I thought he was acting weird.
links.link: - I thought he was acting weird.

passages.name: AI stranger things

passages.text:
He quickly understood the hint, and first I, and then he quickly moved to the edge of the terrace.

- Well, what can you say about the new CAR game?

I thought for a few seconds:

- I think its potential is huge. But still, it's realistic to beat her, as far as I can tell.

Saddam scratched his beard thoughtfully.

- Okay, that's good. Do you have anything to say about the team?


{{rival}}[[London dweller annoys me]]
{{friends}}[[It seems to me that Mr. Horn and the Doubleday twins are beyond competition]]
[[It is difficult to say something until a serious opponent has been met. As soon as it appears, then we will find out]]

links.name: London dweller annoys me
links.link: London dweller annoys me

links.name: It seems to me that Mr. Horn and the Doubleday twins are beyond competition
links.link: It seems to me that Mr. Horn and the Doubleday twins are beyond competition

links.name: It is difficult to say something until a serious opponent has been met. As soon as it appears, then we will find out
links.link: It is difficult to say something until a serious opponent has been met. As soon as it appears, then we will find out

passages.name: {{deal}} Look at Darvish and slightly nod your head to the side, inviting you to move away

passages.text:
In what sense is this strange? Jurgen and Andrew looked at me.

I thoughtfully picked at my Caesar salad.

- Well, as far as I know in military affairs, we fought with a specialized anti-tank bot, right?

"Yes," Jurgen nodded.

- If so, then such a technique has instructions for use. Combat regulations, to be more precise. That is, this robot had to have a certain pattern of behavior.

- So what? asked Acharya.

- In fact of the matter. This pattern did not exist. I looked at all three in turn. - Any opponent, and AI in particular, can be read. He was trained to act according to a certain model. I turned off the fog that covered the area of he second arena for myself, and almost immediately began to maneuver.

I devoured the lettuce toast without much appetite, chewing thoughtfully.

Not only did he act faster. He obviously read my actions.. No, not even like that. In a way, he manipulated my actions. It's hard to explain, but this AI is more complicated than it looks. I would like to see his model.

Everyone I spoke to looked at each other. Jurgen looked at me.

- And if you get it, how can you disassemble it?

[[- I think it's possible, but it needs a model{{hacker}}]]
[[It is hard to say. Some AIs I was testing for months, but it’s hard to imagine how long this one will take]]

links.name: - I think it's possible, but it needs a model{{hacker}}
links.link: - I think it's possible, but it needs a model{{hacker}}

links.name: It is hard to say. Some AIs I was testing for months, but it’s hard to imagine how long this one will take
links.link: It is hard to say. Some AIs I was testing for months, but it’s hard to imagine how long this one will take

passages.name: - I thought he was acting weird.

passages.text:
Jurgen chuckled thoughtfully, as if talking about something in his head.

- When this game is released, it will probably be possible to climb a little in its contents. I can not wait to feel this neural network too- Andrew dreamily drawled.

I looked at him. He and his sister, did not suspect that they were swimming among sharks. So Michael said. Perhaps it's even for the better.

- You know what, Andrew, maybe we can do a little collaboration on this topic when I finish my science project? I will introduce you to the team with which I am engaged in reverse engineering of networks.

- Oh, that would be great! Then,  meet us in New York together with your sister.

I smiled. So, let him think that everything is in order ..

I held out my hand to him.

- I would be glad to host you.

We shook hands. Andrew took a glass of orange juice, which he ordered instead of alcohol, and we clinked glasses.

[[- To cooperation!]]

links.name: - To cooperation!
links.link: - To cooperation!

passages.name: - I think it's possible, but it needs a model{{hacker}}

passages.text:
- And that's right .. - Jurgen said thoughtfully and went somewhere in his thoughts.

He was probably trying to imagine how complex a structure like the one we're testing would be.

Ajitt Acharya at this moment slightly raised his hand to attract attention.

- Speaking of reverse engineering, Mr. Runner, have you already tried to disassemble my model for space probes to capture passing asteroids?

I strained my memory. I think I did something like this two months ago.

- Yes, there was something like that, I remember. But, my team is still too busy to understand the issue in detail. Maybe you will come to us in America for a month?

- I'd love to, but to be honest, I'm also more interested in what we're testing here.

- Then maybe you and Andrew can come to me together? Together, it will be much faster to disassemble this riddle from CAR.

Andrew Doubleday nodded.

- Definitely. I'm in.

With these words, we raised our glasses and goblets, and lightly clinked.

[[- To cooperation!]]

links.name: - To cooperation!
links.link: - To cooperation!

passages.text:
I had barely taken a sip of champagne from my glass when Andrew's sister, Lindsey, swooped down on us.

- Hey, big guy, what are you talking about without me?

She approached Andrew from behind and firmly squeezed his shoulders around the collarbones with her fingers.

- Damn, Lindsey, let me go!

- You have no chances, huh! - with these words, she painfully poked her brother somewhere in the area of the shoulder blades.

- What an infection!... - Andrew, though smiling, sharply escaped from the grip of the girl.

The Acharya and I laughed as we watched this scene. I cleared my throat slightly and then looked at Lindsey.

“Miss Doubleday, my brother and I were discussing that it would be a good idea for us to get together in New York to do some network analysis, which we are currently testing.

- Well, well - Lindsey took the nearest chair and sat down between me and her brother - let’s from this place in more detail.

I briefly told her about what I was doing with my research group. Everyone else had already heard everything, so only she listened, sometimes interrupting:

- So, wait, you mean that the AI was playing with you? So what?

[[-That's what I felt - I shrugged.]]

links.name: -That's what I felt - I shrugged.
links.link: -That's what I felt - I shrugged.

passages.name: - To cooperation!

passages.text:
Lindsey laughed.

- And in my opinion, Miles, you just ran out of imagination! AI similar in complexity to a human is prohibited. And besides, this is too much for some kind of toy!

Well, I don't have proof. Besides, I didn't see the model. Maybe it was made up so that it gave the impression of a manipulator.

- You definitely need to rest! Already building conspiracy theories - the girl giggled, and then got up from the table. - Don't stay here for long, okay?

With these words, she poked her brother in the shoulder with her fist, and walked away from the restaurant.

[[{{meet}}Come to Ana]]
[[Go to room]]

passages.text:
The girl from the airport was sitting alone, quietly having lasagna. All this time I was trying to remember if I had seen her somewhere before, before Athens. But nothing came to mind.

Taking my glass, I stepped closer:

- Miss Tikhomirova? Did I remember correctly?

Cold pale eyes looked at me again. After hearing no response, I decided to continue:

- Do you mind if I sit down?

- No, not at all.

Like last time, the conversation wasn’t flowing. Maybe that's her thing, keeping her distance from everyone?

- You know, I wanted to ask you something. How did you receive an invitation from CAR?

Ana frowned slightly.

- That means?

- Well, you see, I know almost everyone in this company in absentia. Someone because of reports, someone for new models of neural networks or other discoveries. And what do you work for, if it's not a secret?

- Oh, that's... I'm a senior researcher at a research institute in Russia. We develop software for the military industry.

[[- Oh, that means you work for the government.]]

links.name: - Oh, that means you work for the government.
links.link: - Oh, that means you work for the government.

passages.name: {{meet}}Come to Ana

passages.text:
Perhaps for today, all I want is to fall into bed and fall into an extremely deep sleep.

The evening air pleasantly cooled the body. I wrapped myself in a blanket, and decided that tomorrow would still be better ...

[[Severe deception of virtuality]]

links.name: Severe deception of virtuality
links.link: Severe deception of virtuality

passages.name: Go to room

passages.text:
- Well, yes.

It was amazing. There's no way I'd light up that I work for Langley, life is too valuable to me. And then .. Maybe they have it in the order of things?

- Aren't you afraid that by saying this, you will attract too much attention?

She considered.

- I don't know anything to be interested in me. Just work.

With that, she continued to devour the lasagna, occasionally looking out to sea, which was visible from the restaurant's terrace.

[[- Well, me too, I work for the government in a way {{trust}}]]
[[- You are brave. I would never tell even if it was true{{shine}}]]

links.name: - Well, me too, I work for the government in a way {{trust}}
links.link: - Well, me too, I work for the government in a way {{trust}}

links.link: - You are brave. I would never tell even if it was true{{shine}}

passages.name: - Oh, that means you work for the government.

passages.text:
Anna choked and coughed  at these words. I gave her a glass of water, which she drank gratefully.

Slightly catching her breath, she looked at me very intently.

- Tell me I misheard.

I looked around. There seemed to be no one around to overhear us.

- No, I'm quite serious.

- And you want to say that you are also not afraid to talk about it?

She stared  at me, which made her feel a little uneasy.

- Well, it stays strictly between us cause you have also opened up to me.

- And who do you work for?

I thought. Was it worth talking?

- Well, sort of.. Uncle Sam has a lot of enemies and all that. Well, you understand, don't you?

I smiled awkwardly. Ana looked at me for a few more seconds, and then sharply shook her bright red hair:

- I think I understand ... - she paused. I don't know why we're talking about this, but since it's like this...

She looked me straight in the eyes.

- I'm not here because I really want to play in the new AI. Do you understand me?

[[- Seems that I do]]

links.name: - Seems that I do
links.link: - Seems that I do

passages.name: - Well, me too, I work for the government in a way {{trust}}

passages.text:
- No braver than you, Miles.

She smiled broadly and made me shudder. It was as if a huge nail had been driven into me with just one phrase. Such a sudden change of tone was too unexpected.

Clearing my throat, I took a sip of champagne from a glass, and asked a completely logical question:

- In what sense? Why do you think I'm brave?

- Didn't you notice, I'm... how it is in your... an outsider of our company.

She looked me straight in the eyes.

- And yet, you communicate with everyone the same way. What's the point of this?

[[-There are no outsiders for me. And besides, we're all outsiders here, in some sense]]

links.name: -There are no outsiders for me. And besides, we're all outsiders here, in some sense
links.link: -There are no outsiders for me. And besides, we're all outsiders here, in some sense

passages.name: - You are brave. I would never tell even if it was true{{shine}}

passages.text:
So we might help each other...

She leaned back in her chair and looked at me once more, this time smiling warmly. I didn't even know it was possible to smile so sincerely at someone I had only recently recognized.

- You know, Miles. I hope we get out of all this. And we will discuss everything at one table already somewhere far away from here.

I looked around.

- Yes, that would be great.

With these words, I drank the rest of the champagne and got up from my chair, while Miss Tikhomirova got up from hers.

- See you later, Miles.

She smiled slightly and walked away from the restaurant. I shook the glass in my hand.

Was it the right decision to show all the cards? She might work for intelligence too, right?

Taking a deep breath, I set the glass down on the table. It's too late to think about it. We need to rest and prepare for tomorrow's battle.

[[Go to room]]

links.name: Go to room
links.link: Go to room

passages.name: - Seems that I do

passages.text:
- That's how?

She rested her chin on her palm and smiled very warmly.

- If so, do you mind discussing our work somewhere outside the hotel tomorrow? All the same, Athens is a tourist city, there is where to go.

- Well, I do not mind

- That is great. Then, I'll wait for you at the end of the third arena. And thanks for the company

With that, she got up from the table and walked out of the restaurant. I remained in frustration.

Everything in this place moves too fast for me...

- Me too. First day. Until we arrived, he was already the first to stand on the island. Either he knows something, or he's too good.

Darvish looked at Riley Cavill, who was actively chatting with Mr. Ishigami.

"Maybe you have any ideas how to slow him down, Mr. Runner?"

I thought:

- You can think of something .. But only within the game. It is unlikely that we will be able to do something here, unless you manage to negotiate with Nakamoto.

- With a Japanese?

- Yeah. They seem to be on the same wavelength.

- Hmm... Okay, we have time. Anything else come to mind?

[[It is difficult to say something until a serious opponent has been met. As soon as it appears, then we will find out]]

-  He's a little out of this world. Well, I think so. I would not write him down as a serious contender for victory.

- That's how it is. Okay, the same is better for us, right?

[[It is difficult to say something until a serious opponent has been met. As soon as it appears, then we will find out]]

links.name: It is difficult to say something until a serious opponent has been met. As soon as it appears, then we will find out
links.link: It is difficult to say something until a serious opponent has been met. As soon as it appears, then we will find out

passages.name: It seems to me that Mr. Horn and the Doubleday twins are beyond competition

passages.text:
- Aye aye, Mr. Runner. Too little for two days, and time is running out for us, you understand?

I chuckled thoughtfully. What a game this Darvish is playing. After thinking for a while, I looked at him carefully, and then said:

- If something happens, I will definitely tell you. And do you have something?

- Well… a little bit - Darvish answered evasively, shaking his head - the next robot is an experimental robo-spider, created for covert operations.

- Covert, huh?

- Yes, but that's all. My friend from the local CAR department can't take much risk. But personally, I would prepare for a very intense fight.

With these words, Darvish patted me on the shoulder.

- Well, I'll go. I look forward to good news from you.

passages.text:
July 8, 203X

I ran as fast as I could. The third arena looked like a deserted night city, but in fact it was a real maze in which it was very easy to get confused.

Everything was gray and monotonous. Real stone jungle.

Hearing the rattle of metal behind me, without turning around I launched a good portion of napalm somewhere in the direction of the sound. I was chased by a spider the size of a moth

[[Fire another volley from the flamethrower]]

links.name: Fire another volley from the flamethrower
links.link: Fire another volley from the flamethrower

passages.name: Severe deception of virtuality

passages.text:
This time there was something like a gurgle. It looks like I hit something important, but I kept running anyway.

There were only three possible restrictions in this arena - turning off the radar, shooting, and speed limit. This time I turned off the radar.

During the time that I have been testing this AI, it has become obvious that you should not give him at least any information about yourself. He can turn the slightest data against me.

But even so, he overtook me, and tried to attack from above, then from the gateway.

Before I had time to think about it, the spider appeared on the wall. Fingering with his paws, he ran as fast as he could, already preparing the blades hidden in his limbs.

[[Intercept the laser rifle and attempt an aimed shot{{hurt}}]]
[[Throw an EMP grenade and try to break the distance]]

links.name: Intercept the laser rifle and attempt an aimed shot{{hurt}}
links.link: Intercept the laser rifle and attempt an aimed shot{{hurt}}

links.link: Throw an EMP grenade and try to break the distance

passages.text:
Maybe a well-aimed shot would calm him down?

Keeping this thought in my mind, I let go of the flamethrower, leaving it hanging from my belt, and took up my rifle.

In less than a second, the spider jumped right at me. A sharp pain pierced my entire left shoulder, and screaming loudly, I squeezed the trigger. A shower of sparks flew from somewhere near the belly, and the spider jumped to the ground, backing away.

I fired a few more shots, driving him around the corner. He won't stay there for long...

The wound was bleeding very much, another such mistake, and this can already be considered a defeat ..

[[Take a rifle better and go to the frontal]]
[[Throw a grenade around the corner, and turn into the nearest unoccupied passage]]

links.name: Take a rifle better and go to the frontal
links.link: Take a rifle better and go to the frontal

passages.text:
So it  won't go away that simple.

Pulling the pin, I threw a grenade right at him. A second passed when the grenade exploded right in front of his muzzle with a light flash. For a second, the robot shorted out.

[[-Gotcha!]]

links.name: -Gotcha!
links.link: -Gotcha!

passages.name: Throw an EMP grenade and try to break the distance

passages.text:
Now I need to knock out something important before he wakes up from the discharge.

Releasing the flamethrower from my hands, I immediately grabbed the laser rifle hanging from my belt, and taking aim, shot directly into the spider's muzzle.

As luck would have it, he was shaking from EMP, so that the laser beam fell somewhere in the joint. One of the bastard's legs broke. Great, now it doesn't run like that.

I have to run before he wakes up.

Quickly running away, not expecting any pursuit, I moved as far as possible from my opponent and prepared to wait.

The building I entered was a mini market.

Suddenly an idea came to me. It's quite dark here, and even with all the iron on me, it will be difficult to scan me among the racks. That means, there is an opportunity for an ambush.

Thinking that, I glanced at the shelves. Large can of beer. If you throw it well, there will be plenty of noise. The best deception.

Deciding so, I took the jar and threw it out into the street with all my might. The beer inside the can frothed and ripped open the precarious packaging from the inside, causing a strong hiss to be heard throughout the area.

It will definitely grab attention.

[[Wait for the spider to appear]]

links.name: Wait for the spider to appear
links.link: Wait for the spider to appear

passages.name: -Gotcha!

passages.text:
There is nothing to lose. It certainly is not designed for frontal attacks. So as long as I see him, there is a chance.

Adrenaline was overflowing, dulling the pain. I took a stronger rifle, and ran forward, no more fear ...

[[Cruel reality...]]

links.name: Cruel reality...
links.link: Cruel reality...

passages.name: Take a rifle better and go to the frontal

passages.text:
Again pulled out the check, a sharp bang, retreat. You can't take any more risks.

Hiding behind a corner, I took out an electronics scanner. The signal was weak, but it was. So he stayed there. We urgently need to decide what to do.

[[Попытаться устроить засаду чуть дальше по улице]]
[[Keeping the scanner at the ready, go to an open area, and prepare a rifle]]

passages.text:
Я осмотрелся. Луч света в этом городе посреди степи бил впереди. Но добежать до туда не получится, он все равно быстрее.

Я посмотрел на плечо. Да и бежать слишком далеко не удастся..

Перехватив проклятую винтовку поудобнее, я короткими перебежками бежал от одной стены другой, от одной к другой. Таким способом я смог завалиться в какой-то минимарке.

Снова сканер. Поблизости робота точно нет. Нужно остановить кровь. Зубами рву упаковку медпакета и прикладываю его к ране. Вот так, теперь можно сражаться.

Я осмотрел свое временное убежище еще раз. Здесь только два выхода, для посетителей и для персонала. Во второй можно сбежать. Значит, нужно подловить  его у первого.

Я взял первый попавшийся предмет и метнул его в открытую дверь. Алюминиевая банка довольно громко ударилась, разбрызгивая пиво и шипя. Это он точно заметит.

[[Wait for the spider to appear]]

links.name: Wait for the spider to appear
links.link: Wait for the spider to appear

passages.name: Попытаться устроить засаду чуть дальше по улице

passages.text:
It's dangerous to get out. But as long as I see him, and he sees me, the chances are equal.

Carefully watching the icon on the scanner, I waited. Soon the grenade will stop working, and he will attack again. We must not miss this moment.

I don't know how many seconds passed, but I stood still. A light trickle of blood trickled down my arm, and I slowly weakened. I wanted to lie down..

Suddenly, my opponent was on the move again. The scanner found it flawlessly. He climbed the wall again. Is it going to attack from above again?

I need to make a decision.

[[Stand still and keep the spider at gunpoint]]
[[Move forward and while he's in sight, fire as many suppressive shots as you can.]]

links.name: Stand still and keep the spider at gunpoint
links.link: Stand still and keep the spider at gunpoint

passages.text:
We didn't have to wait long. It looked like it had some kind of noise masking system, but I still heard it. In absolute silence, I readied my rifle and held my breath.

Nothing happened for a couple of minutes. Obviously, the robot understood that something was unclean, and was in no hurry to leave.

[[Gently pull out the scanner and point it outside]]

links.name: Gently pull out the scanner and point it outside
links.link: Gently pull out the scanner and point it outside

passages.name: Wait for the spider to appear

passages.text:
Its head was pounding and his ears were ringing.

It wasn't a hangover. Rather, the strongest migraine that I had to feel in this life.

Its eyes seemed to be filled with blood, the eyelids did not want to rise.

The last thing I remember was the spider sitting on top of me, tearing and throwing clothes and flesh. And then...

You fought bravely, warrior. But now your story is coming to an end.

Exactly.

Despite the pain, I opened my eyes, still in the same town. And she was standing in front of me. Warrior.

- What...

- Accept death with dignity, because only you can understand how important it is - to die with honor.

With these words, she raised the machine gun and aimed it at me. A second, and the line flashed through me through and through. My body didn't listen to me anymore. I was dying....

[[Bright lamp light]]

links.name: Bright lamp light
links.link: Bright lamp light

passages.name: Cruel reality...

passages.text:
- Calm down, this duel will win the cold-blooded ..

Waiting, I stood. It knew exactly where I was.

So, now it is coming right behind me, I just need to understand the moment when it will attack. And then I'll take it down with a couple of accurate shots.

Another half minute passed. It slowly crawled out somewhere at the level of the third floor. We knew for sure that we were seeing each other.

Jerk. I jumped back a little and unleashed a volley of laser rifles with one hand. The distance was too great, only a couple of shells hit its hull. But it was enough to throw off its disguise.

The scanner is now useless. Dropping it to the ground, I took the rifle in both hands and took aim. If I hit well, then a couple of shots will be enough ...

Suddenly, the spider jumped just like last time, but from a much greater height. I tried to aim at its belly and squeezed the trigger. A shower of sparks flew from my opponent's belly, but it flew at me anyway. I can't make it...

A heavy iron carcass fell right on top of me, knocking me down. The second pair of front paws pressed my hands hard to the ground, and with the first pair of front legs, the spider swung high above its head and released the blades.

This is the end...

[[Cruel reality...]]

links.name: Cruel reality...
links.link: Cruel reality...

passages.name: Stand still and keep the spider at gunpoint

passages.text:
I don't know what he's up to, but his plan can be broken. This means you have to be unpredictable.

I lowered the scanner and ran forward as fast as I could to where he was climbing.

Turning the corner, I raised the radar to the sky and saw that he turned on the cloaking system again. But that won't help him.

I realized where he was, and throwing the scanner on the ground, took up the rifle. A long burst of pulses went up the wall where the spider had been. Several shells hit him directly, temporarily disabling his trump card.

-DIIEEE!!

I aimed a little better and squeezed the trigger. It tried to jump from the third floor straight at me, but I kept shooting. Thoughtlessly, until the gun overheated.

Instead of a robot, only some melted remains fell to the ground. I fired a couple more shots into its snout, more out of anger than necessity, and then my hands suddenly trembled and weakened.

Everything was over.

[[Go to the city center]]

links.name: Go to the city center
links.link: Go to the city center

passages.name: Move forward and while he's in sight, fire as many suppressive shots as you can.

passages.text:
Ten minutes later, I was standing in the town square, relieved. Again this feeling that nature is blooming.

Lindsey, Avigdor, Jurgen, Ana, and Nakamoto were already here. But the warrior who always met us was not here.

Something was wrong.

Jurgen and Ana had cuts on their faces, and Lindsey bit her lip as she held on to her injured leg. Obviously, she couldn't walk fast, but somehow managed to.

I approached the others and asked:

- The others are still there, right?

- Yes. - answered Jurgen. - And they've been there too long.

I looked at Lindsey, and she looked at me:

- That damn robot didn't show up until the very end. I walked half the arena with the pin pulled out from a grenade! Is it possible to make such a dishonest opponent?

- I'm not sure...

I did not manage to agree. Suddenly, it was as if a veil had been lifted from the surroundings, and we saw the main street.

There were four spiders in different places, and next to them ..

- ANDREW! Lindsey screamed.

Lindsey's brother was lying on the ground with a bruised head and was barely crawling on the ground. Besides, Saddam was crawling right behind him. His legs turned into some kind of bloody mess.

[[-What a horror is going on here...]]

links.name: -What a horror is going on here...
links.link: -What a horror is going on here...

passages.name: Go to the city center

passages.text:
Calm down, slowly..

I turned on the device and aimed it. My opponent was standing right at the door.

Such a chance should not be missed.

Very slowly, I aimed the muzzle of my rifle at the spider, still in disguise, took leisurely aim at its head, and pulled the trigger.

The laser spoke, first blinding the sensors, then completely destroying them. The spider let out something like a squeal, and began to wave its paws from side to side.

- It's time to finish.

Throwing the last grenade, I made the robot stop twitching, and only after that I came out to my full height and with pleasure squeezed the trigger on the rifle, burning hole after hole in the hull.

A few seconds - and the main processor is damaged. The killing machine crashed to the ground, covered in melted pieces of metal.

The hunter has become the prey.

[[Go to the city center]]

links.name: Go to the city center
links.link: Go to the city center

passages.name: Gently pull out the scanner and point it outside

passages.text:
As soon as I said that, I noticed that the Warrior Girl was walking behind everyone.

She held her machine gun in her hands, and slowly walked forward, looking down on the fallen.

First she approached Ajittu Acharya, who was trailing behind everyone:

You fought bravely, warrior. But now your journey is coming to an end. Smile at me, for you will accept death at my hands..

With these words, she aimed her muzzle at Ajitt, and fired a long burst at his body. He did not even have time to scream, as two bullets went through his skull, scattering fragments of the skull on the asphalt.

Anna screamed in horror somewhere behind, and I could not tear myself away from the spectacle.

The warrior slowly walked towards Riley, who was struggling to crawl away from the girl backwards.

- No, no.. It's not fair! NPCs don't behave like that, I demand revenge!

A cold voice answered him only one thing:

- Nothing to fix. You fell like a warrior, so accept death like a warrior.

With that, Riley screamed, but a short burst to the chest quickly ended his wailing.

- We're not going to die, are we? Am I dreaming this? muttered Avigdor.

The same story repeated itself with Saddam. He tried to say something, about the fact that he was a CAR employee, and he should not be killed, but the girl was adamant. Another fell.

Only Andrew remained.

- Andrew, no! Faster!

Lindsey ran forward.

[[Grab her by the shoulder and pull her with all her might]]

links.name: Grab her by the shoulder and pull her with all her might
links.link: Grab her by the shoulder and pull her with all her might

passages.name: -What a horror is going on here...

passages.text:
Jurgen and I held Lindsey together, but she struggled to break free and even hit us.

And Andrew, meanwhile, was crawling forward with all his might, but he was terribly lacking in strength. The warrior was getting closer, ten steps, eight, six...

Your family will not forget you. Smile at them before it's too late...

The guy lifted his face and looked at Lindsey. His eye was lacerated.

- Do it for me, Lindsey.

- Andrew!!

The girl's scream was interrupted by a short burst. The guy fell to the ground, and a pool of blood slowly began to spread under him.

The bloody harvest was over.

As if not noticing our confusion, the warrior walked forward to another mirror and turned to us:

- This stage turned out to be tragic for you. That is the price of any victory. A victim.

She laid the machine gun on the ground and spread her arms wide.

- So you know, warriors. My name is Pallada. And you dared to challenge me. Many have fallen to make me like this. I hope you become better than me. After all, the only way you have a chance to reach the end.

[[To be continued..]]

links.name: To be continued..
links.link: To be continued..

passages.name: Grab her by the shoulder and pull her with all her might
To be continued..

passages.text:
I woke up in the CAR office, in the same place where we had been sitting all day.

My head hurt even more, I tried to get up, but my whole body seemed to be paralyzed. Maybe they tied me to a chair?

Despite the noise in my ears, I could hear people running around the room. There were some screams, among which a woman's cry was clearly heard.

- Andrew... Andrew, wake up. I beg you, Andrew!

With barely obedient hands, I took off my helmet, and blinking, I tried to look around. I wasn't tied. but the whole body ached.

- Andrew, please... Wake up..

Lindsey sat on the floor, holding her brother by the shoulders. He himself was on a stretcher. His face was covered in blood from his nose and his eyes were closed. His skin was too pale to be alive.

At that moment, Mr. Lee entered the office, examined three more bodies on a stretcher, and looked at me:

- Wow, you're a tough nut to crack, huh, Mr. Runner? Few survived clinical death in another world!

I somehow sat on the edge of the bed and stared at him with an angry look.

[[-What does all of this mean?]]

links.name: -What does all of this mean?
links.link: -What does all of this mean?

passages.name: Bright lamp light

passages.text:
My head hurt even more, but I said it as loudly as possible. Everyone looked at us, and even Lindsey looked up with tearful eyes.

- Oh, well, how can I tell you. The fact is that the helmets, how to say it, are not fully tested. So if you die in the virtual world, there may be .. consequences.

He smiled as warmly as possible, but I was only trembling. I've been fighting to the death all this time.

- Yes, how did it come to your mind, tell me for mercy?

- This is not my idea, I'm just solving a development problem. You know, subjects go all out when their lives depend on the result of the test.

Mr. Lee clapped his hands theatrically and about a dozen people entered the hall with tasers in their hands.

- Gentlemen, please take everyone who stayed to the hotel. Politely.

At these words, he turned around.

- I thank you all for taking part in our Pallada project. I hope we reach new horizons with you. Good luck!

He walked away, and the survivors were surrounded by men in black.
The trap closed.

[[To be continued..]]
